title: CaC2 rxn - predict precipitation of Ca(OH)2 Q vs K

content.description:
Reaction 1: CaC2(s) + 2 H2O(l) → C2H2(g) + Ca(OH)2(s) 

Reaction 2: NaOCl(aq) + 2 HCl(aq) → Cl2(g) + NaCl(aq) + H2O(l)

Reaction 3: C2H2(g) + Cl2(g) → C2H2Cl2(g)
content.question: Ca(OH)2(s) precipitates when a 1.0 g sample of CaC2(s) is added to 1.0 L of distilled water at room temperature. If a 0.064 g sample of CaC2(s) (molar mass 64 g/mol) is used instead and all of it reacts, which of the following will occur and why? (The value of Ksp for Ca(OH)2 is 8.0 x 10-8.)

choices.label: Ca(OH)2 will precipitate because Q > Ksp .
Ca(OH)2 will precipitate because Q < Ksp .
Ca(OH)2 will not precipitate because Q > Ksp .
Ca(OH)2 will not precipitate because Q < Ksp .

content.answer: Ca(OH)2 will not precipitate because Q < Ksp .

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
